title: Auxiliary Gift Shop ProMedica Toledo Hospital, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Auxiliary Gift Shop

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital
2142 N. Cove Blvd.

content.description:
Welcome to the ProMedica Toledo Hospital Auxiliary Gift Shop, a project of the ProMedica Toledo Hospital and Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital Auxiliary. The Auxiliary Gift Shop provides a convenient retail shopping experience for our guests and employees. Proceeds support Auxiliary funded patient services and projects to enhance care and comfort. The Gift Shop is located inside Entrance A of Toledo Hospital, on the first floor, next to the cafeteria.

Stocked with fresh flowers, balloons, and a variety of sundries, gifts, and seasonal items, you are sure to find the perfect gift for your loved one. If you would like to send a gift to a patient on our campus, you can place a phone order. Click here to see some of our popular gift items. VISA, MasterCard, Discover and American Express are accepted.

Flower & Gift Deliveries

Gifts and fresh flowers can be delivered to patient rooms. Phone orders placed by 4 p.m. will be delivered to a patient room the same day. There is no delivery fee.

Fresh flowers cannot be delivered to patients in Intensive Care Units, however mylar balloons are permitted. Delivery for on-campus only.

title: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio

content.name: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio
content.description:
Why Choose Northwest Ohio Cystic Fibrosis Center

ProMedica's Cystic Fibrosis Center is accredited by the National Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. We serve patients from the 21-county geographic regions of northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan. Although we are a pediatric office, our Cystic Fibrosis Center provides care for pediatric and adult patients. We use a multi-disciplinary approach to meet all of your cystic fibrosis related care needs. Our care team consists of pediatric and adult physicians, nurse coordinators, social workers, dieticians, respiratory therapists and research coordinators. To provide you with the best patient outcomes, our CF Center participates in the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Patient Registry. This Registry tracks patient outcomes, enabling informed decision making about quality improvement and standardized care for patients with CF.

Our long-established program has also received Quality Improvement Awards from the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation for sustaining quality improvement work that has led to better health outcomes for people with cystic fibrosis.

In 2006, a robust clinical research program was developed within our Cystic Fibrosis Care Center, in conjunction with the Cystic Fibrosis Therapeutics Development Network (TDN). The TDN was created by the CF Foundation and is one of the largest CF clinical networks in the world, bringing together experts from across the country to evaluate the safety and efficacy of new CF therapies. Our center is currently enrolling patients in research studies aimed at developing new gene-targeted therapies to correct the basic defect that causes cystic fibrosis. By working in collaboration with the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation and industry sponsors, we hope to one-day find a cure for CF.

Contact

Lead Research Coordinator: Kelly Hoot, RN, BSN - Kelly.hoot@promedica.org
Adult Coordinator: Amanda Schreiner RN, BSN - Amanda.schreiner@promedica.org
Pediatric Coordinator: Tyger Adoure-Zehaim RN, BSN - Tyger.Adoure-Zehaim@promedica.org

title: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center | ProMedica

content.name: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center
content.description:
A State-of-the-art Facility Made for You

Our renovated space was designed with you and your family in mind.

Our center includes:

  • Private and semi-private rooms with accommodations for overnight guests.
  • A rehabilitation gym.
  • A large, 3-room transition apartment.

We encourage families to visit the facility before making a decision on a rehabilitation facility. To be sure staff members are available to answer your questions, we suggest you contact us to schedule a tour in advance.

Please call 419-824-6066 for more information or to arrange a tour.

Take a Virtual Tour

Inpatient Rehab to Help You Reach Your Highest Potential

You want care focused on your function and independence. Our expert rehab staff of doctors, nurses, therapists, and case managers provides you with needed support as you adjust to changes from an illness or injury.

Our staff is highly trained to treat various conditions, including:

  • Stroke.
  • Brain injury.
  • Spinal cord injury.
  • Multiple trauma.
  • Fracture/joint replacement.
  • Amputation.
  • Complicated orthopaedic conditions.

Our state-of-the-art facility is CARF accredited (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) and specializes in acute care rehabilitation. We use intensive therapy and education to help you reach your highest potential.

You’ll have access to:

  • 24-hour nursing care.
  • Daily physician visits.
  • Daily physical, occupational or speech therapy.

Robotic Exoskeleton Therapy and Rehab

The Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center offers the first-ever FDA approved, wearable robotic exoskeleton. The EksoNR™ helps stroke and spinal cord injury patients gain mobility quicker, and gain more confidence and independence as well. The device uses support mechanisms and real-time adjustments so that patients are supported as they re-learn correct step patterns, weight shifting and posture.

Learn More

Frequently Asked Questions

What sets Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center apart from other programs?

Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center features spacious private and semi-private rooms with ample space for relaxing and family visiting. In addition, we have a 3-room transition apartment where patients can test their readiness for independent living. The goal of the transition apartment is to give patients the opportunity to practice tasks and become confident in their abilities prior to discharge.

Do you have specific admission guidelines?

We use pre-admission criteria established by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services. This ensures that the patients entering the program will benefit from participation. Our personnel work closely with families, discharge planners, and other medical and rehabilitation professionals to gather information and plan treatment programs for the earliest discharge possible.

Does your staff have experience treating patients with specific diagnoses?

Our team of experts have received extensive training in rehabilitation interventions for patients after stroke, brain injury, spinal cord injury, multiple traumas, complicated orthopaedic conditions, hip fracture, amputation, burn, pain, or other illness. Our team of physicians, nurses and therapists have hundreds of years of combined clinical experience in rehabilitation with proven results. Over 80% of our patients return home upon discharge.

How much therapy is provided?

Therapy involves many components beyond the traditional physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech-language pathology available in many hospitals. Rehabilitation nursing, case management and therapeutic recreation also work as members of our interdisciplinary team to provide a comprehensive rehabilitation program for inpatients. Therapies are scheduled daily, with the goal of patients working toward being able to tolerate three hours of therapy a day or 900 minutes per week.

Who makes up the medical staff at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Our medical directors are board-certified physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians. In addition to physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians, internal medicine physicians are also available to care for patients’ medical needs while they are in our care. Since we are located on the Flower Hospital campus, patients have convenient access to emergency and consultative services. You can have peace of mind knowing you will have prompt attention to your medical needs.

What’s the family’s role in rehabilitation?

Family members and friends are considered a special part of the treatment process. Staff members work closely with families during education sessions to provide hands-on learning of skills and adjustment techniques in preparation for the patient’s discharge. During the patient’s stay, families are encouraged to assist the patient with bathing, toileting, dressing, and exercise after instruction by staff.

How do you keep patients and families informed?

A case manager serves as a liaison, facilitating communication between staff, families and patients. At weekly conferences, team members discuss the patient’s progress, set new goals and plan for discharge. The length of a patient’s stay varies widely. The case manager shares progress reports with patients and families at regular intervals. Meetings with the physicians, therapy team, patient and family are strongly encouraged.

When are visitors allowed?

The primary caregiver is welcome at any time with accommodations for overnight stays if necessary. Other visitors are welcome Mon. – Fri., 5 – 8:30 p.m., and Sat. – Sun., noon – 8:30 p.m.

Who pays for services at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Generally, services are covered by most insurance companies. We also accept patients covered under Medicare and Medicaid programs. Insurance is verified prior to admission. For questions, please call your insurance company.

What happens on the day of discharge?

To ease the discharge transition, the case manager will work with the patient and family to arrange for continuing outpatient or in-home treatment support as indicated. Community resources are arranged prior to discharge.

title: Jobst Medication Therapy Management - Adrian - Anticoagulation Services, Medication Management - ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital, Adrian, Michigan (MI), 49221

content.name: Jobst Medication Therapy Management - Adrian

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital
5640 N. Adrian Hwy.

content.description:
Jobst Medication Therapy Management is comprised of specially trained clinical pharmacists and support staff that work closely with you and your provider to give you dedicated management of your medications. Together we will manage your medications by making sure you receive effective treatment, routine monitoring and ongoing education.

Our clinical pharmacists will:

  • Answer any questions you may have about your medications.
  • Verify your medications are safe to take together.
  • Review your lab values and medical history to ensure safe medication use.
  • Resolve any side effects that you are experiencing.
  • Determine if there are cost-saving opportunities.
  • Provide education to you and your family, including:
      • Review each medication’s dose, frequency, route, technique, and reason for taking.
      • Review your over-the-counter medications, supplements, and herbals.
      • Provide you with an updated medication list during the visit.
  • Discuss ways to help you remember to take your medications.
  • Discuss how to decrease your risk of falls if taking certain medications that can contribute.
  • Help to quit smoking.
  • Provide weight loss support.
  • Offer vaccine recommendations based on your age and medical history.

Our Services

Our clinical pharmacists work closely with your provider to help manage the medications that you take for:

  • Asthma
  • Blood flow such as anticoagulants (blood thinners)
  • Blood pressure
  • Cholesterol
  • COPD
  • Diabetes
  • Heart attack
  • Heart failure
  • Mood

content.name: Jobst Vascular Lab - Toledo
content.description:
Jobst Vascular Laboratory is a full-service laboratory that provides many different types of state-of-the-art diagnostic tests. But ultrasound is the most important tool in our lab and the one we use the most.

A duplex ultrasound uses sound waves to take pictures of your vessels and a Doppler to listen to blood flow through your arteries and veins. The exam is painless and easy for you. But it provides invaluable information for your physician.

Studies performed in our vascular lab include:

  • Cerebrovascular studies of the blood flow to the brain: Carotid artery duplex, transcranial artery duplex (TCDi)
  • Venous: DVT (deep venous thrombosis), CVI (chronic venous insufficiency), APG (air plethysmography)
  • Arterial studies to determine the amount of blood flow in your arms and legs: ankle-brachial Index (ABI), pulse volume recording (PVR), segmental pressures, duplex scan graft surveillance
  • Abdominal studies to check the blood flow in the arteries and veins in the abdominal cavity: ultrasound of the inferior vena cava, aorta, kidney and visceral arteries

Read more about vascular lab services at ProMedica...

title: Kaitlyn's Cottage - Respite Care - 1260 Ralson Ave., Defiance, Ohio (OH), 43512

content.name: Kaitlyn's Cottage
content.description:
What Is Kaitlyn’s Cottage

There once was a grandmother with a dream.

Her dream was that her granddaughter, Kaitlyn, would once day have a place where she could experience life, friends and fun just like her siblings. And that her daughter and son-in-law, Kaitlyn’s primary caregivers, would be able to take time for themselves while feeling that Kaitlyn was safely being cared for and enjoying her time with friends. This grandmother envisioned a warm, safe place that was full of laughter and encouragement for everyone.

In 2012, the dream came to life and Kaitlyn’s Cottage opened its doors. Kaitlyn’s Cottage is a country cottage providing day, evening and overnight respite for people who live with intellectual and physical disabilities.

Services are provided in a warm, home environment that has a large accessible kitchen, great room with fireplace, library, activity rooms, accessible bathrooms and four private bedrooms.

Although located on the campus of ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital, Kaitlyn’s Cottage is a non-medical respite care facility. If a participant has intensive medical needs, they will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis within the scope of our care.

Individuals of all ages needing respite care are welcome.

Services

Daytime, evening, weekend and overnight respite services can be scheduled on any given day or time to accommodate your family’s need. Daytime respite can range from just a few hours to an entire day. The number of participants that can be served is dependent on the special needs of each individual and the planned activities. Overnights can range from one night, a weekend, even an entire week or more. Up to four participants can stay each night.

Parent and Caregiver Resources

For our families, we offer Cottage Connections meetings. Here, you will feel like part of a community comprised of those who are experiencing the joys and challenges that all caregivers of individuals with special needs face. You will be able to relax, enjoy conversations and share with other caregivers – mothers, fathers, grandparents, siblings – who “get it.”

Interested in Staying at Kaitlyn's Cottage

Fill out interest form

Application Process

No one will be denied respite support based on inability to pay. With the generous donations from our community and the support of ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital, we are able to offer respite services to our families on a sliding fee scale based on each family’s household size and income. If you have any questions about payment and billing, please don’t hesitate to contact us. We will be happy to discuss personalized payment options with you.

If you are interested in volunteering or donating to Kaitlyn’s Cottage, please contact us at 419-783-4411. We invite you to use your skills, passions or resources to serve at Kaitlyn’s Cottage.

Take our virtual tour

title: Neurosciences Center | ProMedica

content.name: Neurosciences Center
content.description:
When faced with a neurological condition, you want access to high-quality outpatient care close to home. That’s why ProMedica and the University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences have teamed up to bring world-class neurosciences care to you.

As regional leaders in health care and education, we are committed to improving the quality of life for all patients with brain, spine, nerves and muscle disorders and disease. With the creation of the neurosciences center, we are expanding our academic affiliation which began in 2012.

By collaborating, our two organizations bring together the best of clinical practice and academia to enhance access and continuity of care, while also furthering national research and education efforts.

Our Facility

The three-story, 122,000 square foot building on the north campus of ProMedica Toledo Hospital provides an easily accessible location with convenient parking and centralized registration. The modern architecture and design of the building reflects the innovation and creativity that will take place within its walls. The building also features a major art installation inspired by the neurosciences.

Clinical Care

A multidisciplinary team of experts including nearly 40 specialized neuroscience physicians from ProMedica and the University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences practice together in one location.

    Our team includes:
  • General and subspecialty trained neurologists and neurosurgeons
  • Specially trained nurses and advanced practice providers
  • Neurophysiology technicians
  • Physical therapists
  • Audiologists

Meet our team

Education

Medical students, residents and fellows are exposed to a wide variety of experiences and medical cases to enhance their education in an exciting and collaborative education setting.

Research

At the neurosciences center, science researchers interact daily with neurology and neurosurgery clinical staff within the departments of neurology and neurosurgery. This means our physicians are focused on treating the symptoms of the medical condition, as well as understanding and discovering the underlying cause.

This “bench-to-bedside” approach is available only in academic medical centers and provides patients treated through the neurosciences center with early access to the latest and most promising solutions to their conditions.

content.name: Pediatric Specialty Services
content.description:
ProMedica Pediatric Specialty Services makes it convenient to get expert, specialized care for children. We offer a wide range of services on the second floor of the Center for Health Services, close to ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Our family-centered care gives families access to leading-edge treatments from compassionate care teams.

Services We Provide

Pediatric Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Our pediatric physiatrist and healthcare staff coordinator provide care for children with physical disabilities to diagnose, treat and educate. We help them reach their functional goals to improve their quality of life.

Pediatric Genetics

Our affiliated pediatric geneticist and support team, including genetic counselors and registered nurse coordinators, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric genetic disorders.

Pediatric Rheumatology

Our affiliated pediatric rheumatologist and support team, including a RN coordinator and social worker, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric rheumatology disorders.

Adult and Pediatric Muscular Dystrophy Center

Our physiatrists and pediatric neurologist work with the Muscular Dystrophy Association and multi-disciplinary team that includes an orthopaedist, registered nurse coordinator, social worker and physical and occupational therapist. Together, they diagnose, treat, educate and coordinate care for patients with muscular dystrophy diseases.

Pediatric Neurology Seizure Clinic

Our pediatric neurologist and registered nurse coordinator diagnose, treat and pediatric patients with neurological diseases, with a special focus on seizure disorders.

Pediatric Down Syndrome Clinic

Our pediatric developmental specialist and registered nurse coordinator provide care for children with Down syndrome. We coordinate their care and help them reach their functional goals with an emphasis on quality of life.

Pediatric Infectious Disease

Our affiliated team of infectious disease specialists, including a physician, advanced practice provider, and registered nurse coordinator, diagnose, treat and provide education on children’s illnesses associated with infectious disease.

content.description:
Founded in 2001, ProMedica Bay Park Hospital is a community hospital serving the city of Oregon, Ohio, and our rural communities east of the Maumee River.

Our medical campus features:

  • A state-of-the-art hospital with 72 private beds.
  • A professional office building dedicated to doctors' offices and outpatient rehabilitation.
  • A treatment and diagnos​tic center.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital was designed with your comfort and healing in mind, with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at Bay Park Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided at a ProMedica site free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Auxiliary

Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals’ health and wellness mission. Consider joining us! For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3648.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on health in our community. ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Bay Park Hospital.

content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-690-7703

The Cancer Center in Oregon, Ohio

But, the true differentiator between the Cancer Center at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital compared to other healthcare systems, is the care and focus poured into each cancer patient. Cancer care through ProMedica offers support programs for patient families as well as patients to ensure a comforting process and transition.

title: ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital
content.description:
The ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital is nestled on M-52 in Adrian Township. The hospital is over 200,000 square feet, consisting of 40 medical-surgical beds, 10 critical care beds, four operating rooms with three minor procedure rooms, 27 emergency rooms, eight labor and delivery rooms and full diagnostics.

Take a Virtual Tour

Cancer Care at Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital

Health and Wellness Campus

The Health and Wellness campus also includes the state of the art 32,000 Frank and Shirley Dick YMCA and the ProMedica Wellness Center. The YMCA houses a family pool and a therapy pool, a gymnasium, kids' space, fitness /workout rooms and locker rooms, as well as ProMedica Total Rehab rehabilitation treatment modalities and aquatics. ProMedica Farms and Hoop House is on campus. The Hoop House is a medical-clinical facility that is handicap accessible. It houses the diabetes program and offers numerous rehab opportunities. Produce grown on the Farm goes directly to the community via the Veggie Mobile. The Education Center at the Farm offers opportunities for the community to learn and explore. The campus also offers two miles of walking paths.

Scholarships

Applications are now available for the 2022 Charles and Virginia Hickman Clinical Scholarship. Eligible applicants include students interested in clinical healthcare careers, with an emphasis on programs supporting clinical and patient care positions. The scholarship does not include advancements in licensure. We have limited donated funds for potential and current students to receive full tuition coverage with an expected two-year commitment of employment at CVHH.

Application forms can be submitted to Lexus.Winstead@promedica.org.

Download Scholarship Application Form

content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital. Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 517-577-0000

About this Location

Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 517-424-3291. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

  

The Emergency Center features:

17 private beds

1 psych bed

Four SANE-A certified nurses

Four SANE-B certified nurses

Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

Offering PCI for interventional cardiology

Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Stroke Care Network partner)

Heart Care Center partner with Borgess Heart Center for Excellence and Bronson Advanced Cardiac Healthcare

 

Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Learn more about emergency and trauma at ProMedica Herrick.

content.name: ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital - Foot and Ankle
content.description:
Feet have a lot of stress put on them. While it’s normal to sometimes have aches and pains, if you have constant foot or ankle pain, it’s time to find relief.

Regular visits to a podiatrist can keep your feet and ankles healthy. ProMedica’s team of foot and ankle doctors can evaluate and treat foot conditions before they turn serious. Our goal is to help you keep doing the activities you love, without pain.

Turn to the experts at ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital. Our staff works with each individual patient to provide specialized care for their unique needs.

Whether you’re suffering from arthritis of the foot and ankle, flatfoot deformity, sports injuries, or chronic foot pain, we have the experts and surgical services at ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital for podiatry care close to home.

title: ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.name: ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital - Labor and Delivery
content.description:
Baby Central

You’re pregnant and want comprehensive care for you and your baby. ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital is dedicated to the medical needs and overall health of women in our community through a full range of diagnostic, childbirth and childbirth education services.

Where is the Birthing Center? The birthing center is located on the second floor of the hospital. It incorporates the latest technology in a luxurious, state-of-the-art setting. Our goal is to help you have the birth experience you want.

What services are available? Services offered include:

  • Labor, delivery, recovery and postpartum suites that are beautifully furnished to offer you, your loved ones, and your new baby a comfortable, friendly environment
  • Your choice of whether or not to use medications or an epidural during labor
  • Operating room suite available for Cesarean birth
  • Fully-equipped Level 1 nursery available to address a newborn’s basic needs when rooming with mom is not an option
  • Experienced physicians and nurses to assist you with pregnancy, birth, postpartum, and/or new newborn needs
  • A lactation consultant to provide additional support with the breastfeeding experience

Are the birthing suites private?

Yes. Our private birthing suites allow you to have a family-focused birthing experience. Our expert staff members do everything possible to anticipate and meet your desires and needs.

Childbirth Education Classes

This free five week program to help you prepare for your birthing experience, and what care baby will need after arriving.

Classes cover:

  • Warning signs of labor and stages of labor
  • Knowing your options and creating a birth plan
  • Unit tour of the birthing center
  • Postpartum care of mom and baby
  • Breastfeeding

Now Available

UroLift® - UroLift® is a minimally invasive implant procedure to treat enlarged prostate. This in-office procedure is performed in about 30 minutes UroLift® is a great alternative to medications or major surgery with no cutting, heating or removal of prostate tissue.

Bladder BOTOX® - Bladder BOTOX® is for women who are experiencing incontinence issues. This in-office procedure takes just 30 minutes with no recovery time. BOTOX® is injected directly into the bladder muscle, and helps block nerve signals that trigger Overactive Bladder (OAB).

content.name: ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital - Women's Health Center
content.description:
Diagnostic Services

You have access to a variety of diagnostic services including:

  • Breast mammography and ultrasound
  • DEXA (bone density screenings)
  • Breast MRI

ABUS (Automated Breast Ultrasound)

ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital offers Invenia ABUS screening technology for womens health and to the 40 percent of women who have dense breasts. Women with dense breasts have a four to six times greater risk of developing breast cancer compared to women who don't. In addition this density makes it more likely for lumps or masses to be missed with a standard mammogram. Unlike 2-D or 3-D mammography, which uses radiation, ABUS uses sound waves to create clear ultrasound 3-D images of the breast tissue. That way, radiologists can find cancers overlooked on a mammogram or standard ultrasound...or more quickly disregard false negatives. It gives the physician hundreds of additional pictures to review along with your mammogram results - helping to detect 35.7 percent more cancers in women with dense breasts than mammography alone.

title: ProMedica Comprehensive Adult Sickle Cell Clinic - Sickle Cell Disease - 2142 N. Cove Blvd., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Comprehensive Adult Sickle Cell Clinic
content.description:
The Adult Sickle Cell Clinic is located in the Adult Oncology & Infusion Center on the 1st floor of ProMedica Toledo Hospital Renaissance Building -- to get there, arrive at Entrance B.

The adult Sickle Cell Clinic is designed to help coordinate and manage the care of the adult Sickle Cell patient by using a multi-disciplinary approach.

When you are an adult Sickle Cell Clinic patient our staff will:

  • Coordinate appointments with specialists as ordered by our hematologist.
  • Review and manage home medications along with the hematologist.
  • Provide social services to assure any barriers to care are addressed.
  • Address any concerns and support your needs.
  • Provide maintenance infusion services along with intermittent infusions based on your needs.
  • Triage appointments and coordinate your care under the direction of the hematologist.

    • Patients may be referred by their physician or a self-referral.

content.name: ProMedica Comprehensive Pediatric Sickle Cell Clinic

address.addressOne:
2142 N. Cove Blvd.
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital, Renaissance Building, 4th Floor

content.description:
The Pediatric Sickle Cell Disease and Hemoglobinopathy Clinic, which started in 1996, cares for patients with all forms of sickle cell disease.

At the clinic, children receive comprehensive care, preventive therapy such as prophylactic antibiotics and immunizations, and important screening for stroke risk and other known complications. They also have access to treatment, such as hydroxyurea and other new treatment options for sickle cell disease.

Parents of children who receive an abnormal newborn screening, whether for sickle cell trait, thalassemia, or other hemoglobin variants, are provided counseling and education through the clinic in conjunction with the Region III Ohio Department of Health Newborn Screening Coordinator.

The ProMedica COVID Care Clinic is located at the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center on Monroe St. in Sylvania. Enter the building through Entrance B and you will find the clinic in suite 111-A.

The clinic provides support to patients with longterm residual effects from COVID-19. Our goal is to improve your quality of life and get you back to feeling your best.

OUR APPROACH
Our clinic offers a multidisciplinary team of specialists who works together to provide you an individualized care plan. Specialties include:

  • Allergy.

  • Cardiology.
  • Family medicine.

  • Neurology.

  • Physical medicine and rehabilitation.

Ebeid Children’s Hospital provides comprehensive, compassionate care and support for children diagnosed with cancer, blood disorders and bone marrow failure syndromes. title: ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital is located about 60 miles southwest of Toledo in Defiance, Ohio. Our facility was constructed in 2002, with state-of-the-art medical technology and access to some of the most experienced and talented medical professionals in our region.

We designed our hospital to promote a healing environment for all Defiance community members.
content.operatingBody: Visiting hours are flexible during open hours, 6 a.m. - 10 p.m.
content.volunteer:
Our volunteers make a difference in people’s lives everyday. At ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital, you can connect with patients and their loved ones and make their experiences easier.

You can volunteer in the following areas:

  • Beautiful Beginnings. The ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary sends a mailing to new and expectant mothers. This includes advice and guidance for pregnancy, birth, and the first year of their child’s life.
  • Coffee Cart. Hot specialty drinks and doughnuts are sold by our ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary from the coffee cart in our hospital lobby, Monday through Friday mornings.
  • Gift Shop. The gift shop is located next to the main lobby and is staffed and run by volunteers. Open Monday through Friday.
  • Information Desk. Direct visitors and answer questions from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m., Monday through Friday.
  • Surgery Desk. Help check-in patients before their procedures, notify the families when they are needed, and help to transport patients to the entrance. The surgery desk is staffed Monday through Friday.
  • Thrift Shop. We accept and sell used clothing, accessories, and home décor to raise funds for our ProMedica Regional Hospital Auxiliary projects and services.

Learn more about volunteer opportunities at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital. Contact Gina Sheffel, volunteer and retail manager, at 419-783-6800 or at Gina.Sheffel@promedica.org.

title: ProMedica Device Clinic - Cardiac Electrophysiology, Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD), Leadless Pacemakers, Loop Recorders, Pacemakers, Sub. Implantable Cardioverter Defib. (S-ICD) - 2940 N. McCord Road,, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43615

content.name: ProMedica Device Clinic
content.description:
The ProMedica device clinic is for patients who have had a heart device implanted. This includes pacemakers, implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD), subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (S-ICD), loop recorders and biventricular devices. It’s important to routinely check these devices to make sure they are working right and aren’t causing problems.

Our team is trained to check heart devices manufactured by leading companies including Abbott (formerly St. Jude Medical), Biotronik, Boston Scientific, LivaNova (formerly Sorin Group) and Medtronic.

    At each appointment, our experienced staff of nurses and cardiac electrophysiologists will check your device. The process is called interrogation. A specially trained nurse places a hand-held tool over your clothes on top of the ICD. The tool automatically sends the information that our team needs to:
  • Assess if the device is working normally
  • Confirm the battery life is okay
  • Determine if there have been any abnormal heart rhythm or stocks delivered (for ICDs) recorded
    The interrogation also includes:
      Perform a 4-lead ECG to monitor your heart rhythm
      Check the device for lead integration and signs of lead infection

Some devices can be monitored wirelessly from your home. A small box sits next to your bed. Every night, it collects information from your device and automatically sends it back to our office to review and monitor. This includes abnormal rhythms, lead integrity issues and battery information. For more information about our home monitoring program, please call our office at 419-842-3000.

content.name: ProMedica Endoscopy Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Toledo Hospital Endoscopy Center  at the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center

The ProMedica Toledo Hospital Endoscopy Center  at the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center is an outpatient surgical center in northwest Ohio that specializes in endoscopic procedures. The center combines quality care and state-of-the-art technology with comfort and convenience for patients having low-risk gastrointestinal procedures.
 
We perform more than 5,000 procedures at the ProMedica Endoscopy Center each year. The procedures use a flexible, lighted device called an “endoscope” to look inside the gastrointestinal cavities and organs. These exams help our physicians diagnose and treat a variety of conditions, including ulcers, intestinal bleeding, tumors, and polyps.
 
The ProMedica Endoscopy Center is affiliated with ProMedica Toledo Hospital, which is accredited by The Joint Commission. It is handicap accessible with sufficient parking and a comfortable family waiting room.

content.name: ProMedica Farms
content.description:
About ProMedica Farms

ProMedica Farms is situated on 3 acres on M-52 in Lenawee County. The farm includes several barns, walking paths, and a hoop house for indoor growing. This is part of ProMedica’s effort to encourage healthy eating and preventative care.

The hoop house is made of metal framing and a heavy-duty, translucent plastic film that provides solar heating during the day and protection from the elements. It is a clinical hoop house and is the second in Michigan. The hoop house features raised garden beds at various heights for children and people in wheelchairs, as well as railings and staircases for physical therapy. This will allow patients to learn how to maneuver on different turfs.

Contact Us

Email: promedica.farms@promedica.org

Volunteer at ProMedica Farms

Images


Hoop House


Inside of ProMedica Farms


Outside of ProMedica Farms


ProMedica Farms Overview

The Veggie Mobile

The Veggie Mobile provides a solution to address the availability of local, healthy food throughout Lenawee County, by supporting local agricultural producers and increasing the availability of reasonably priced, nutrient dense, fresh food. By empowering the community to support local producers, the project establishes a source of healthy, farm-to-fork, food retail outlets in food deserts and low-income areas.

In 2014, the program took another step toward reducing food insecurity; a SNAP machine was obtained to extend SNAP recipients' purchasing power and provider further access to fresh fruits and vegetables for low-income residents of Lenawee County. In 2017, the Veggie Mobile began supporting Tecumseh students through the Back Pack Buddies program, which allows 120 students to receive fruit and snacks to supplement meals on weekends.

View the Veggie Mobile Schedule

content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at ProMedica Flower Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest Guides
  • Gift Shop
  • Support Services
  • Patient care services
  • Advisory Councils

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview perspective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season.
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer

Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica free of charge.

Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments / managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our online volunteer application.
  • If you do not have computer access, you may call us to request a volunteer application.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

    • To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-824-1019 or send an email to sarah.hartung@promedica.org

    Apply Online

    Consider a ProMedica Flower Hospital Auxiliary and/or Guild membership. Our members enhance the quality of services for patients and the community through a wide range of activities that support our hospital, ProMedica Goerlich Center, Rehabilitation Center, Hickman Cancer Center, and Ebeid Hospice Residence through:

    • Fundraising and events
    • Special projects
    • Membership

    By offering your time and talents, you gain the sense of purpose and fulfillment that comes from giving back to your Sylvania, Ohio community. We appreciate your help.

    Call the volunteer services department at 419-824-1019.

content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Flower Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place quarterly at noon at ProMedica Flower Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-824-1027

content.name: ProMedica Flower Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-690-7900. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency. 

When you or a loved one needs emergency care, you can trust our staff for the level of care you need. The ProMedica Flower Hospital Emergency staff treats approximately 30,000 patients each year.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 25 private beds.
  • Two radiology suites that provide convenient diagnostic imaging services for fast responses.
  • Immediate access to a dedicated 64-slice CT scan.
  • Primary Stroke Center.

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Air and Mobile Transportation Network is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Call our Emergency Center at 419-824-1442. If you’re experiencing an emergency, call 911 now.

title: ProMedica ForeverFit

content.name: ProMedica ForeverFit
content.description:
ProMedica ForeverFit

Our focus is providing our members with fitness services and a wide range of wellness programs tailored to support healthy aging.

Medically Integrated Fitness Center

As a medically integrated fitness center, ForeverFit has the professional expertise and programming necessary to safely and effectively assist our members to develop, initiate, and maintain an active lifestyle regardless of their current health status. This helps minimize the risk of illness and disease and promotes health and wellness.

How We're Different

  • Our Medical Director provides medical oversight for the facility’s programming in order to maximize the safety of all participants and ensure medically and scientifically sound programs and services.
  • Our professional staff includes fitness team members who have a degree in exercise science and are certified by the National Academy of Sports Medicine.
  • We offer outcome-based fitness programs, such as Script4Fitness, Bridge to Fitness, and Phase 3 Cardiopulmonary Rehab.

Find Us

2865 N. Reynolds Rd.
Toledo, OH 43615

Call (419) 539-0235

Follow us on Facebook

Hours

Monday - Friday: 5:00AM - 8:00PM
Saturday & Sunday: 7:00AM - 2:00PM

Calendars

Group Exercise Calendar

Swim Lane Reservation Schedule

Fitness and Wellness Programs

Group Exercise Classes

We offer classes for all fitness levels:

  • Barre, Cycling, Move & Tone, Boot Camp, Core & More, Group Power and Group Groove.
  • A variety of Yoga classes (Chair Yoga, Yoga Flow, Hath Yoga and Power Yoga).
  • Aqua-Robics (Aqua-Yoga, Gentle Aquatics, Aqua Tabata, Power Aqua).
  • Free Small Group Training Classes (Pilates Reformer and Fascia Release).

ProMedica ForeverFit Fitness App

Enjoy your favorite group exercise classes at home or on the go. The ProMedica ForeverFit app has over 20 different On-Demand Group exercise classes with new classes updated on a monthly basis. Reserve your spot with our quick and easy class booking and swim lane reservations. Log your workouts and food intake and participate in our monthly fitness challenges.

Personal Training

Based on your needs and preferences, we will match you with one of our Exercise Physiologists. Your health goals and medical needs will be integrated into customized, timesaving workout sessions schedule at your convenience. Individual and group training options available.

Pilates Reformer Training

Our professionally trained instructors will guide you through workouts using specialized Pilates Reformer equipment. Pilates promotes core strength, flexibility, strong back and balanced body.

Titleist individualized Golf Fitness Program

Our Golf Fitness program helps you develop a better swing by focusing on the five pillars of the golf swing: flexibility, balance, stabilization, power, muscular strength and endurance.

Wellness Services

We offer a variety of wellness services, including:

  • Massage therapy.
  • Swim lessons.
  • Nutrition counseling, health screenings and cooking demos.
  • Lifelong education opportunities through the Healthy Living Lecture Series on topics such as chronic condition education and caring for aging parents.
​​​​​​​​​​​​

Fostoria Community Hospital is a full-service, critical-access hospital (with the exception of obstetrics/labor and delivery) with Joint Commission accreditation.

Cancer Care at Fostoria Community Hospital

Dialysis Center at Fostoria Community Hospital

Our staff. Here, you and your loved ones benefit from the exceptional and dedicated care from our more than 250 active and compassionate local clinical staff members. We’re neighbors caring for our neighbors.

Community involvement. As one of the largest employers in Fostoria, we’re also deeply invested in the economic and social health and wellness of our community. Our involvement includes the Fostoria Chamber of Commerce and the Fostoria Economic Development Corporation. We also provide resources and leadership support / board involvement for local organizations like the United Way of Fostoria and the Fostoria Kiwanis and Rotary Clubs.

content.volunteer:
Do you want to do something hands-on to make a difference right here in Fostoria?

Renew your sense of purpose and brighten the lives of your Fostoria neighbors by volunteering at ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital. A friendly smile and a human connection may be all it takes to encourage someone’s commitment to better health.

Our volunteers perform many meaningful duties, including mail and flower deliveries and providing guidance at the information desk.

The ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Auxiliary is a group of volunteers that support our hospital’s mission — to improve the health and well-being of our community. We serve as a link between our hospital and our Fostoria area community by:

  • Raising funds for hospital equipment and services, which help the hospital maintain outstanding quality health care.
  • Offering area high school seniors and college students pursuing a career in a health care-related field the chance to get scholarships.
  • Coordinating events and volunteer opportunities.

Contact the auxiliary at 567-208-3702 or volunteer services at 419-436-6649 to explore your opportunities.

content.name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital - Cancer Care
content.description:
At ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital’s cancer and infusion center is your care connected to ProMedica Cancer Institute, the region’s cancer treatment leader. Right here, you have access to screenings as well as inpatient and outpatient treatment for various cancers. Our multidisciplinary network of knowledgeable oncologists are committed to providing you with timely detection, diagnosis and state-of-the-art treatment.

Cancer Treatment Services

Fostoria Community Hospital provides comprehensive inpatient and outpatient cancer services, including:

  • Medical oncology

content.name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-436-6640. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 9 private beds
  • All staff members hold PALS, NRP and ACLS certifications

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

title: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Dialysis Center - Outpatient Hemodialysis (adults only) - 506 Van Buren St., Fostoria, Ohio (OH), 44830

content.name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Dialysis Center

address.addressOne:
506 Van Buren St.
On the campus of ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital

content.description:
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital’s Dialysis Center offers a comforting space to receive outpatient hemodialysis treatment.

The team consists of board certified nephrologists, nurse practitioners, registered nurses as well as a licensed social worker and registered dietician. We are a 10 station dialysis unit able to accommodate 36 patients; utilizing two shifts per day.

Receiving hemodialysis at the center offers several benefits to patients, including an opportunity to socialize with staff and other patients, consistency with treatment plans and a personalized care team. The center provides patient-centered care by supporting patients with more than just dialysis treatments. The dialysis team works with patients and their families to arrange specialty appointments, manage prescription medications, provide assistance with understanding insurance coverages and benefits associated with end stage renal failure, and arranging transient visits to encourage travel.

Patients are educated along the way regarding every aspect of their disease process. Our team of registered nurses provide monthly education and ongoing learning opportunities that are individualized to meet each patient’s needs. Our team works directly with social workers and care navigators at local hospitals to ensure patient safety and provide quality transitions of care following hospitalizations.

The center complies with all regulatory standards and is accredited by Joint Commission and Ohio Department of Health. In 2021, the center received a 3-Star Quality Rating from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

title: ProMedica Headquarters

content.name: ProMedica Headquarters
content.description:
Located in downtown Toledo along Summit and Madison streets, the ProMedica Headquarters campus consists of four buildings and an employee parking garage.

The Junction - 300 N. Summit St.
The Junction office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. Popular fine dining restaurant The Chop House is located on the first floor.

The Plaza - 300 Madison Ave.
The Plaza office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. The primary entrance is off Levis Square on Madison; however, you can also enter from Summit St. Starbucks and KeyBank are located on the ground floor.

The Steam Plant - 100 Madison Ave.
The Steam Plant, located on the banks of the Maumee River, houses the company headquarters. Visitors should use the Madison Street entrance, located near the river, just before the flag poles

The Summit Center - 333 N. Summit St.
ProMedica Senior Care offices are the main tenant/occupant in the Summit Center. Popular eatery Focaccia’s is located on the main floor.

The Depot - 202 N. Summit St.
Located at the corner of Jefferson Ave. and Summit St., the Depot is the parking garage for ProMedica's headquarters.

  • Monday - Friday, from 6:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., parking in the ProMedica Depot parking garage is limited to downtown employees and employee visitors, downtown YMCA members and Chop House employees.
  • Paid parking is available to the public at the Depot after 4:30 p.m. on weekdays, and on weekends (from 4:30 p.m. on Friday - 6:30 a.m. on Monday).

All non-employee visitors to ProMedica should park at any available public parking location. All visitors need to check in at the front desk to receive a visitor badge. Visitors are also required to have an escort in the building at all times.

Campus Map
For additional information, including addresses, public parking info and entrance locations, download our campus map.

title: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

content.name: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center is a brand new, state-of-the-art facility on the second floor of ProMedica Toledo Hospital. Providing the highest quality of heart rhythm care in Toledo, the center treats simple to complex heart arrhythmias. Our team of electrophysiologists is the largest and most experienced in Toledo. They treat premature ventricular contraction (PVC), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), atrial fibrillation (AFib), atrial flutter, atrioventricular nodal reentry tachycardia (AVNRT), Wolff-Parkinson-White Syndrome, and ventricular tachycardia (VT).

Take a virtual tour of the ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

title: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

content.name: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Flower Hospital
5300 Harroun Road. Suite 010

content.description:
ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center resides on the campus of ProMedica Flower Hospital, a Division of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of our cancer center.

 

ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania is the central hub of our ProMedica Cancer Institute’s services and highly-specialized technologies for cancer care. As an award-winning cancer center, we’re committed to giving you the best possible oncology care here in Toledo, Ohio. From early detection and diagnosis to inpatient and outpatient services, you’ll receive the full spectrum of cancer services at our Hickman Cancer Center.

Cancer Center Treatments and Therapies
As one of the largest radiation providers in the region, we offer highly-advanced cancer treatments and therapies:

  • Cardio-oncology keeps your heart healthy during cancer treatment.
  • Trilogy Linear Accelerator and Stereotactic System delivers higher radiation doses to smaller areas over a shorter time period.
  • HDR (high-dose rate radiation) therapy delivers higher radiation doses directly into certain tumors.
  • Outpatient medical oncology services treat and support people with cancer.
  • Infusion services support medical oncology and non-oncology patients requiring infusions but who don’t require an inpatient stay.
  • Software programs assist in treatment planning and pain management.
  • Eclipse™, a comprehensive treatment planning system that simplifies complex radiation therapy planning for each patient on a case-by-case basis.

Lung Clinic
Get a customized lung cancer treatment plan at this lung specialist-lead clinic. Learn more about the ProMedica Cancer Institute Lung Clinic.

Genetic Testing
If you have multiple cancer risk factors, we offer a genetic testing program led by our dedicated medical director and licensed genetic counselors. Learn more about genetic cancer testing at ProMedica.

Survivor Center
The ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center is home to the Survivor Center, a program for you if you’ve completed active cancer treatment.

Learn more about ProMedica Cancer Institute.

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Memorial Hospital
content.description:
Located in Fremont, Ohio, ProMedica Memorial Hospital has served the citizens of Sandusky County and the adjacent communities since 1918. In fact, our hospital was built with funds raised by members of our community on land donated by the family of former United States President, Rutherford B. Hayes.

Our medical campus features:

  • Advanced Certification as a Primary Stroke Center by the Joint Commission (2020). Take our free stroke risk assessment. You can email Krista Schumm if you have any questions. Click here to visit ProMedica's stroke information page.
  • 43 licensed beds, featuring comprehensive emergency, inpatient and outpatient services.
  • The state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, constructed in 2002.
  • The Herbert-Perna Center for Physical Health, constructed in 2007, which offers occupational health services as well as rehabilitation and aquatics centers.
  • A birthing center with six private labor, delivery, recovery, and postpartum rooms, one labor tub, two triage rooms, a nursery with a larger viewing area, one critical resuscitation room, and a NST room, newly re-built in 2019.

Download our community benefit report.

Our History

In 1913, Mary Miller Hayes, daughter-in-law to the late President Rutherford B. Hayes (a Fremont resident), pledged $50,000 of her money, as well as her home, toward the construction of ProMedica Memorial Hospital. This gift, however, could only be realized provided the citizens of Fremont raise an additional $75,000 for the hospital.

The matter rested until 1915 when members of the community went into action. Over the course of six days in October of that year, a whirlwind fundraising campaign known as “Fremont Never Fails” took place. The campaign resulted in $99,672 raised in addition to Mary Miller Hayes' initial $50,000 endowment.

Construction of Memorial Hospital began on August 14, 1916 on land donated by Mary Miller Hayes and her husband, Col. Webb C. Hayes, second son of President Rutherford B. Hayes. The hospital opened its doors on October 4, 1918.

Today, ProMedica Memorial Hospital is a 43 licensed-bed hospital that continues to offer comprehensive, compassionate medical care to the communities we serve.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers are important members of the care team at ProMedica Memorial Hospital. Men, women, and students volunteer to do many tasks around the hospital, and are vital to our success, and the satisfaction of our patients.

Some of the areas where volunteers help around the hospital include:

  • Mailroom.
  • Patient transport.
  • Gift shop.
  • Hospice/home health.
  • Information desk.
  • Spiritual care.
  • Golden Threads office.

Volunteers work in most departments at the hospital, and can accept permanent, temporary or on-call roles. Our volunteer leader will work with you to find a role that works best for you.

To volunteer, you must be at least 16 year of age and have a written statement from your family physician verifying your physical and emotional well-being.

If you are interested in volunteering, download and complete the volunteer application below, or call the volunteer office. Volunteers are also required to go through a short interview with our volunteer leader. Volunteers will receive training and orientation from hospital employees or senior volunteers.

For more information, call volunteer services at 419-334-6609.

Download our Memorial Hospital volunteer application.

When ProMedica Memorial Hospital first opened its doors in 1918, a group of concerned women became actively involved with helping this non-profit institution provide quality care.

Since that time, the Auxiliary of ProMedica Memorial Hospital has financially assisted the hospital with major expansions and has continually supported many other projects .The auxiliary provides its support by raising funds and by providing services that help the hospital maintain outstanding quality health care.

Projects the Auxiliary of ProMedica Memorial Hospital has supports annually include:

  • Annual Health Education Scholarships – awarded to students pursuing a career in health care. Apply for the Annual Health Education Scholarship.
  • Main lobby renovations at hospital
  • Women’s Diagnostic Center Renovation (Digital Mammography)

The Auxiliary of ProMedica Memorial Hospital raises funds through:

  • Christmas Greeting Project
  • Browse-N-Buy Gift Shop
  • Book and Jewelry Sales

content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Memorial Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place quarterly at 5:30 p.m. at ProMedica Memorial Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-334-6682

title: ProMedica Memorial Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.description:
ProMedica Memorial Hospital offers comprehensive maternity services.

Your Growing Family Is Our Priority

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, we have a team of highly trained physicians and nurses, including lactation experts, to ensure that you receive seamless, high quality care throughout your stay with us.

ProMedica Memorial Hospital birthing center and OB services include:

  • Pre-admission tours
  • Pre-admission information sessions
  • Family and children services coordination
  • A secure unit
  • Board certified lactation consultants for breastfeeding support
  • Individual education
  • Childbirth, sibling and breastfeeding support classes

Our OB unit is equipped with private LDRP rooms, so you can remain in one place throughout your stay.

Take a Virtual Tour

PC users: please use Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome to view the virtual tour. Virtual tour will not load in Internet Explorer

.

At ProMedica Memorial Hospital, every room was designed with patient and family privacy as a top priority. Our birthing suites offer labor, delivery, and recovery all in one private setting. Your baby can remain with you in your room throughout your stay with us. There is even plenty of room for your family support person to stay with you overnight to allow for bonding and special time with the new baby.

As you prepare to go home with your new baby, our staff will provide you with the information you need to care for your baby and yourself. Our nurses are happy to answer your questions and help you anyway that we can.

content.description:
We provide surgical services in the family-friendly, state-of-the-art Weitzel-Kern Surgery Center, which is located in ProMedica Memorial Hospital.

From hip-replacement and spine surgeries, to endoscopic and minimally invasive gynecological procedures as well as non-invasive operations, our professionals provide top-notch, compassionate care to patients and their families.

Our physicians are specially trained in many areas of surgery, including:

  • ACL/MCL repair
  • Endoscopy
  • Ear, nose and throat (E.N.T. and Otolaryngology)
  • General surgery
  • Urology
  • Gynecology
  • Opthamology (eye surgery)
  • Orthopaedic surgery (bones and joints)
  • Total joint replacements (hips, knees, shoulders)
  • Podiatry (foot surgery)
  • Minimally-invasive surgery

Our many minimally-invasive procedures allow you to quickly return to your daily life.

Our surgery center was built in 2002 to maximize patient comfort and privacy. Surgery, post-operative recovery, waiting and discharge are all on the same level, minimizing patient transport and maximizing convenience. The patient recovery area is extremely private and comfortable, while the lobby, with its natural lighting and fireplace is an ideal setting for family and friends to await their love ones.

For more information, call ProMedica Memorial Hospital at 419-332-7321.

title: ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital - Labor and Delivery

content.name: ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital - Labor and Delivery
content.description:
Maternity Services

Today's parents want their children born into the warm embrace of family. To accommodate that desire, ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital has completely renovated its obstetrical unit. 
The hospital offers expectant parents six spacious, luxuriously appointed labor-delivery-recovery rooms, commonly known as birthing suites. Filled with homelike furnishings and soft lighting, the birthing suites provide an atmosphere that's warm and comfortable. And they are large enough to allow family members to share in the joy and wonder of birth. 
While the birthing suites resemble a home bedroom, all the modern equipment needed to ensure the health of the mother and child is in place. 

In addition to large, more comfortable accommodations, the birthing suites allow the mother to remain in one place during all phases of the birth. Because you don't have to move from room to room, the family can spend the first precious hours of life with its newest member in a tranquil comfortable setting.

 ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital is also a proud member of the Monroe County Great Start Collaborative, which promotes and supports early childhood issues.

Check out our online baby gallery!
