content.name: ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital - Radiology
content.description:
Radiology

When you need to have a test done, it's nice to know there is a hospital that offers convenient appointments to fit your schedule. To request an appointment for a test or procedure, either call Central Schedule at (734) 240-4188 or complete our online appointment request. 

Our Diagnostic Imaging Services consist of:

Computed Tomography (CT)

  • Two 64-Slice CT scanners with low dose radiation
  • Siemens SOMATOM Definiton AS
  • Siemens SOMATOM Perspective
  • Larger opening for more comfort
  • Sliding gantry available for diverse applications such as trauma and interventional procedures like CT-guided angiography
  • Able to accept patients up to 600 pounds
  • Ability to offer same-day, next-day appointments
  • All CT technologists are registered

Diagnostic Imaging

  • No appointment needed

Fluoroscopy Imaging

  • Examination includes UGI, Small Bowel, Esophagus, Barium Enema, and Modified Barium Swallow. 

Interventional Radiology

A minimally invasive treatment for vascular and non-vascular disease, using small catheters and catheter-based instruments guided by radiological imaging techniques such as x-rays, fluoroscopy, ultrasound, and CT.

Exams include abscess drainage, needle biopsies, thoracentesis, paracentesis, and chest tube placement, to name a gew. Eight Specialty Registered Nurses and Registered Technologists assist the Radiologist with these procedures.

Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)

  • 1.5-Tesla MAGNETOM Aera with exclusive Siemens technologies
  • TIM 4G (fourth generation Total Imaging Matrix)
  • DOT (Day Optimizing Throughput)
  • TIM and DOT offer a faster, more comfortable experience for patients
  • Superb image quality offering wide range of applications such as orthopedic and cancer
  • Large bore with an ulta-short opening (70 cm wide by 145 cm long) alleviates most concerns of claustrophobia
  • Able to accept patients up to 550 pounds 

Nuclear Medicine

  • Two, dual head gamma cameras to maximize efficiency and resolution.
  • Correlating scheduling with other imaging departments for continuity of care such as Cardiac stress tests, CT and Ultrasound.
  • Ability to examine patients who have sesitives to contrast media or magnets. Nuclear Medicine uses radioisotopes without contraindiction. 

Ultrasound

  • 3 Philips IU22 machines provide quality examinations to specific areas in the body with the ability of 3D and 4D images.
  • Assists with biopsies and specialized interventional procedures.
  • Ultrasound guided breast core biopsy using the Mammotome Biopsy System, a minimally invasive state-of-the-art technology which is performed in an outpatient setting. 
  • Compliments mammography in Women's Health with breast ultrasound as well as cyst aspirations and needle localizations. 

PET/CT

  • GE Discovery ST is designed to help physicians diagnose and localize cancer faster than ever before.
  • Potention reduction of invasive procedures such as biopsies and unnecessary surgeries.
  • Accurate location of cancer lesions, identification of benign versus malignant lesions, and differentiation from scar tissue. 
  • The ability to monitor the effectiveness of treatment and adjust the plan during, rather than at the end of, treatment. 

Located throughout Monroe County for Your Convenience

Licensed by the College of American Pathologists and the American Association of Blood Banks, ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital offers full service testing for both inpatients and outpatients seven days a week, 24-hours a day. Outpatient blood draw services are available at the main campus and at various locations throughout Monroe County.

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospita

content.description:
By managing your pain, we'll help you
return to your everyday life - and live again.

We provide treatments that reflect the most recent advances in the management of pain at ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital. We take a multidisciplinary approach toward pain management that involves in-office procedures, physical and aquatic therapy and sometimes medication.

We diagnosis and treat:

  • Neck pain, including work-related injury and "pinched" nerves
  • Back pain, including work-related injury and sciatica
  • Persistent pain after back or neck surgery
  • Headaches
  • Pain/headaches after whiplash
  • Arthritis pain of neck or lower back
  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy or RSD)
  • Nerve damage pain
  • Chronic pelvic pain - Interstitial Cystitis
  • Shingles pain (Postherpetic Neuralgia)
  • Muscle pain

We offer these services:

  • Discography/Spinal Diagnostic Procedures (Cervical, Thoracic, Lumbar)
  • Epidural Steroid Injection
  • Facet Joint Injection
  • Intradiscal Electrothermal Therapy (IDET)
  • Radiofrequency Treatment
  • Intraspinal Drug Therapy
  • Spinal Cord Stimulation (SCS)
  • Myoneural Injection (with or w/o Botox)
  • Nucleoplasty Procedures
  • Selective Nerve Root Block (Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injection)
  • Superior Hypogastric Plexus and Splanchnic Nerve Block ("Celiac Plexus" Block)
  • Sympathetic Blocks (Stellate Ganglion Block, Lumbar Sympathetic Block)

Although a physician referral can be helpful, it is not required for an appointment at the ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Pain Management Center.

If you have questions, or would like to schedule, contact ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Pain Management at 419-436-6765.

ProMedica Physicians Gynecology | Oncology - Sylvania - Clinical Research Trials, Dysplasia Evaluation and Management, Medical Oncology, Post-treatment Surveillance, Registered Dietitian Support, Surgical Oncology - 5308 Harroun Rd., Sylvania, Ohio (OH), 43560

content.name: ProMedica Physicians Gynecology | Oncology - Sylvania
content.description:
ProMedica Physicians Gynecology | Oncology – Sylvania is the largest Gynecology Oncology practice in the area. All of our providers are trained in dysplasia and colposcopy from the American Society for Colposcopy and Cervical Pathology(ASCCP). Our ProMedica Cancer Institute Women’s Sexual Health experts are specially trained in understanding the unique physical and emotional effects that cancer treatment can have on a woman’s sexuality. Our providers also specialize in:

  • Patient education on women’s health conditions, lifespan changes and overall wellness.

  • Registered dietitian support.
  • Post-treatment surveillance.

ProMedica Physicians Palliative Medicine - Palliative Medicine - 2142 N. Cove Blvd., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Physicians Palliative Medicine
content.description:
Palliative care is specialized care for patients living with serious illnesses. It is patient-centered and focused on providing relief from the physical and emotional symptoms often associated with disease progression.

Palliative care can be delivered in conjunction with curative care and treatment plans are created to match the goals of care expressed by the patient and family, regardless of the stage of disease.

Palliative care is based on the patient’s needs, not the patient’s prognosis. In this way, together, we can develop a personalized plan of care focused on your individual goals. Symptoms from a serious/end stage illness that may benefit from palliative care include:

  • Pain
  • Shortness of breath
  • Constipation
  • Diarrhea
  • Nausea
  • Loss of appetite
  • Fatigue
  • Difficulty sleeping
  • Anxiety and/or Depression
  • Increased confusion

Palliative Medicine may also assist with:

  • Education about and completion of Advanced Directives
  • Coordination across various care settings (transitions of care)
  • Disease specific education
  • Access to local community resources

title: ProMedica Physicians Weight Management

content.name: ProMedica Physicians Weight Management
content.description:
Medically Supervised Weight Management

Are you struggling to lose excess weight? ProMedica Physicians Weight Management can help you take off those extra pounds, and most importantly, keep them off. Having a trained physician create a weight loss plan and monitor your progress provides a unique, individualized weight loss program specific to your needs. Your progress is monitored by a comprehensive team that includes a registered dietitian, and ongoing support is available even after you reach your goal.

Weight Management Options

We develop a custom weight loss program from a variety of medically supervised options, including:

  • Hormones.
  • FDA-approved appetite suppressants (Osyia®, CONTRAVE®, Saxenda®, Metformin).
  • Supplements.
  • Pre-packaged foods.
  • ProMedica Scale Down® (HMR® Program).
  • Bariatric surgery.

Benefits of Medically Supervised Weight Loss

Medical weight loss is a very safe and effective way of losing weight. Individuals who have success with this type of program include those who are:

  • Uncertain about dietary options and what is best.
  • Have problems sticking to a diet due to mood changes and symptoms of low blood sugar.
  • Have lost weight but have trouble keeping it off.

If you’re interested in living a healthier life with medically supervised weight loss, call us at 517-366-5020.

content.description:
ProMedica Pulmonary Clinic is a multi-disciplinary team of physicians, respiratory therapists, nurses, pharmacists, discharge planners and social worker working together to treat your pulmonary disease. Our experts will work to empower you and your family to help you successfully manage your disease.

At our clinics we:

  • Educate patients about their medications and how they work.
  • Show patients how to use their inhaler. Teach proper breathing techniques.
  • Partner with patient’s primary care physician or pulmonologist to carefully adjust their medications – when needed.
  • Make recommendations to improve patient’s current treatment plan, if needed, based on the most recent research and guidelines for pulmonary disease management.

title: ProMedica Pulmonary Rehab - Defiance 1200 Ralston Ave., Defiance, Ohio (OH), 43512

content.name: ProMedica Pulmonary Rehab - Defiance
content.description:
Pulmonary rehab is an individualized outpatient program for patients with chronic respiratory (lung) diseases. Our program helps patients achieve and maintain their maximum level of independence and improves their quality of life.

Our team of registered respiratory therapists, exercise physiologists, registered nurses and dietitians work to provide patients with exercise training, education about their disease and help with breathing techniques.

    Patients experience benefits, including:
  • Improved quality of life.
  • Increased physical strength and endurance.
  • Strengthened breathing muscles, which reduce shortness of breath.
  • New prevention techniques to avoid infections and hospitalizations.
  • Education and support to achieve a smoke-free lifestyle.

A physician referral is required to participate in the program.

content.description:
The Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access Center is located on the fourth floor of ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. The outpatient center was updated in January 2022 and consists of one bronchoscopy room, six private infusion rooms, one treatment and one procedure room.

Services at this Location

The patients cared for range from new born to 17 years of age, and are seeking procedural sedation for minor tests and procedures, recurring infusions, and vascular access health care needs, such as, but not limited to:

  • Sedation for minor procedures/testing- MRI, CT, Nuc Med, Interventional Radiology, Gastrics, Audiology, EEG, Echocardiogram, PICC Insertion, and Lumbar Punctures
  • Pediatric Intravenous device placement for Radiology, Hematology/Oncology, and hospitalized patients experiencing difficult vascular access.
  • Ultrasound guided vascular access- lab draws, peripheral IVs, Midlines, and PICC line insertion.
  • Central line declotting and troubleshooting
  • Intravenous infusions, enzyme replacement therapy, and immunoglobulin therapy
  • Stimulation testing
  • Bronchoscopy and Upper Airway evaluations- provide nursing care and assist for pediatric/neonatal non-sedated and general anesthesia bronchoscopy
  • Urinary catheter placement for fluoroscopy and nuclear medicine studies

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, is a 169-bed facility in Toledo, Ohio established in 1993, and has grown to be the region’s leading pediatric care facility. We offer a full spectrum of medical services to meet the unique needs of children from birth through adolescence.

  • We're accredited by the Joint Commission. We strive to meet the highest national standards for safety and quality of care and are committed to continually improving patient care.
  • We’re the region’s largest Level II pediatric trauma center, providing high quality trauma care for patients during any life emergency.
  • The Hillabrand Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is a Level III 72-bed unit providing care for premature babies as early as 22 weeks gestation and as small as 400 grams (14 oz). Our NICU has individual patient rooms designed to mimic the sheltered environment of a mother's womb.
  • Our pediatric cancer specialists treat patients in our state-of-the-art, yet youthful and whimsical, Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center.
  • We're the first dual-certified asthma program for treating both inpatient and outpatients by the Joint Commission in Ohio.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • NICU Cuddler
  • Child Life (Pediatrics)
  • Hospitality
  • Advisory Councils

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPF 2-step/T-spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap
  • Present proof of flu immunization during the flu season.
  • Present proof of MMR immunization of a positive MMR Titer.
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica Toledo Hospital free of charge.
  • Volunteer applicants must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we cannot handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum service time commitment.
  • We'll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our online volunteer application.
  • If you do not have computer access, you may call us to request a volunteer application.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

    • To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

    Apply Online

    Our Auxiliary

    Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals' health and wellness mission. Consider joining us!

    For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3775.

content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 5 p.m. at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. for Teen Council at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-291-4000

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.description:
The Finnegan Family Autism Center works to set standards to diagnose autism early, offer options for individualized interventions and provide continued care and support. The center is home to the Autism Early Learning Program, as well as Avenues for Autism and iTaalk. The University of Toledo Occupational Therapy Department supports open play sessions in our indoor and outdoor play/sensory areas.

Autism Early Learning Program

When your child is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder, you want solutions and services that address their unique needs.

Located in the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center, the Autism Early Learning Program offers early intensive behavioral intervention services for children with autism utilizing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). The program operates year-around with options for full day and partial day services from the age of diagnosis through 6 years.

Each child’s program is individualized with intervention focusing on building skills in the following areas: communication, behavior, play, socialization, adaptive, and developmentally appropriate skills acquisition. Services are implemented in classroom or therapy settings with 1:1 ratios and options for group learning as appropriate. Dependent on a child’s skills and needs, group learning settings with a behavior analytic approach are also available. Parent training and participation are integral to every child’s success and are mandatory across all programs.

Services at the Autism Early Learning Program are provided by board certified behavior analysts (BCBA) and center-based behavior technicians. Additional therapy services such as speech and language therapy can also be accessed at the center. All services are provided in accordance with Ohio licensure laws.

Enrolling in the Autism Early Learning Program

If you think your child would benefit from the Autism Early Learning Program, our staff can assess your child’s unique needs to determine how best we can support your family.

If we believe our program will help you, we’ll arrange an appointment with one of our team members. If we don’t think the program is a good match for your situation, we’ll recommend other options or provide referrals. Call us to enroll at 419-291-7080.

Parent Involvement

Our goal is to provide the best services possible for children with autism. We encourage you to be an active participant in your child’s - intervention. This includes:

  • Daily written correspondence with your child’s team.
  • Home visits twice a year by your child’s behavior analyst.
  • Parent training participation as indicated in your child’s individualized treatment plan. This may include observation of your child interacting with their team at the center and you demonstrating and practicing skills with your child.

Insurance Coverage and Costs

The Autism Early Learning Program accepts most insurance plans. Potential costs would be dependent upon your insurance plan. Please check with your health plan for specific coverage information.

We are also an approved Ohio Department of Education Autism Scholarship provider. Outside agencies and school districts may also contract for program services.

Operational Hours

ProMedica’s Autism Early Learning Program does operate year-round. Our offices are open 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. ABA services typically take place between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Our Autism Early Learning Program team at the Finnegan Family Autism Center is trained in applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science that uses behavioral techniques to teach children basic and complex skills. It works by reinforcing appropriate behavior while decreasing or eliminating interfering behavior. Opportunities for success are built into the program and adjustments are made as children progress, helping them function better in the world.

The goal of ABA is to go from a 1:1, highly structured teaching environment to a less structured teaching environment in a small group. Then, to go to a naturalistic, large group general education setting.

While using the principles of ABA, we systematically teach and reinforce small, measurable and attainable units of targeted skills. Every skill (small or complex) is broken down into small steps. Each step is practiced until success is achieved.

Spine Clinic in Toledo

ProMedica Spine Care on W. Central Ave. is located in the ProMedica Neurosciences Center adjacent to the campus of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

The spine clinic is a fast-track option for patients who want prompt access to a convenient, comprehensive evaluation of their back pain, spine pain or neck pain.

At our spine clinic, patients receive a back or neck pain assessment and exam, and a recommendation for a spine treatment plan.

Our spine clinic is open to all patients.

  • No referral or prior testing is necessary for an appointment at our spine clinic.
  • We accept patients who are already in treatment or want a second opinion (no provider referral is required).
  • Patients with new or existing injuries and patients with chronic or acute or intermittent back, neck or spine issues are welcome.
  • ProMedica Spine Care also has a spine clinic in Perrysburg at Levis Commons.

Learn more about spine care at ProMedica

title: ProMedica Toledo Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Toledo Hospital
content.description:
50 Best Hospitals in America! We're proud to be named one of Healthgrades® America’s 50 Best Hospitals™ for three consecutive years (2020 – 2022). This award recognizes the top 1 percent of hospitals in the nation for exhibiting clinical excellence for at least four consecutive years.

Proudly located in West Toledo, ProMedica Toledo Hospital:

  • Is the largest acute care facility in the Toledo area.
  • Serves a 27-county area in northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan.
  • Houses 794 hospital beds.
  • Employs more than 4,800 health care professionals.
  • Is comprised of more than 1,000 primary care and specialty doctors, the largest board-certified medical staff in our entire area.

What does this mean to you? You have access to award winning, world-class care right here in Toledo, with a deep commitment to your health and the heart of our community.

Our history informs our future. Our story began in 1874 with a group of non-denominational Christian women who vowed to care for the poor and the sick. They established the original Toledo Hospital in a small home near Bancroft and Cherry Streets.

This commitment still stands today. ProMedica Toledo Hospital continues this dedication to the health of our own northwest Ohio community while attaining the highest national health care industry standards.

Learn more about the legacy of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

We’re your Level I Trauma Center.

Severe injuries, the kind that threaten life or limb, require swift and specialized treatment. We’re one of only 11 Level I Trauma Centers in all of Ohio. Being awarded the highest national recognition that a trauma center can obtain confirms that you’re in a place equipped to handle the most critical injuries. Among other requirements for a Level I Trauma Center, we offer 24/7 access to medical staff and surgeons who are specially trained in trauma care.

We’re the only hospital in our region with a cardiologist available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Commended for our expertise and commitment for emergency cardiac care, ProMedica Toledo Hospital is also certified as an Accredited Chest Pain Center by the Society for Chest Pain Centers.

Get state-of-the-art emergency services at ProMedica Toledo Hospital. Our technologically advanced tools include:

Robotic Surgery

You want faster recovery, fewer post-surgery complications and a smaller incision. Robotic surgery, powered by the da Vinci® Surgical System, enhances capabilities to treat a broader range of conditions using a minimally invasive approach. We proudly offer:

Bloodless Medicine and Surgery Program

content.name: ProMedica Total Rehab - Coldwater
content.description:
We have proudly served the community of greater Branch County for over 40 years.

Our team of physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech language pathologists, and fitness specialists provide individualized treatments in order to give each and every patient a high-quality, personalized experience.

All therapists are state licensed and board certified. We are focused on helping people restore pain-free mobility, whether it is overcoming impairments limiting strength, balance, and flexibility, or helping provide tips and tools for improved independence with daily dressing, bathing, and eating.

Special services:

Pelvic Health

You're not alone in this. One in three women of child-bearing age experiences chronic pelvic pain and one in five women experiences pelvic floor disorder.

Pelvic health issues are common, but not normal. They aren’t just part of aging or having children. Unfortunately, many people put up with it or suffer in silence because they aren’t comfortable talking about it, even with their doctor. If you think you may have a pelvic health issue, we’re here to help.

Pelvic health issues can cause a variety of symptoms in women and men. Here are some of the symptoms associated with pelvic conditions:

  • Severe steady or intermittent pain in the pelvic area
  • Pain during or after intercourse
  • Pain while having a bowel movement or urinating
  • Frequent or urgent urination
  • Leakage or passage of urine or feces
  • Constipation

LSVT BIG

The LSVT BIG program works with patients to improve self-care, walking and other tasks. By using the simple cuing and demonstration, patient and therapist work together to "re-calibrate" movement to a more normal size.

Each session will include research backed LSVT BIG exercises and practice of personalized functional tasks. In only four weeks of time, patients can expect to notice BIG changes in their movement that will make everyday life easier and more enjoyable.

title: ProMedica Wildwood Orthopaedic and Spine Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Wildwood Orthopaedic and Spine Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Wildwood Orthopaedic and Spine Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Wildwood Orthopaedic and Spine Hospital is the region’s first and only dedicated orthopaedic specialty hospital. Our experts are devoted to the diagnosis and treatment of bone, muscle, joint, and nerve conditions and injuries.

A division of ProMedica Toledo Hospital, our cutting-edge facility offers sports medicine, bone and joint care, physical therapy and rehabilitation services, plus casting, radiology, and lab tests.

We’re also home to ProMedica ForeverFit, a health club dedicated to healthy aging. Get personal fitness training, group fitness, and social opportunities centered around your commitment to wellness.

We are a specialty hospital with:

  • Forty-two beds, specifically designed for your orthopaedic and spine needs.
  • A patient-centric environment designed with orthopaedic safety in mind, right down to the selection of flooring material.
  • A natural flow from entrance to exit, architected with lean processes.
  • Six operating rooms, featuring the most advanced surgical equipment available.
  • Experienced surgeons, working on the front lines of orthopaedic surgery methods and healing techniques.
  • A surgical nursing staff specially trained in orthopaedic nursing.
  • Immediate access to blood if necessary during orthopaedic surgery.
  • State-of-the-art pain technology, to manage your pain after surgery (particularly joint replacements), reduces narcotics use and speeds up recovery.
  • Physical therapists who specialize in orthopaedic care.
  • Direct access to experienced specialists in sports medicine, arthritis and osteoporosis care, physical therapy and rehabilitation, and more.

Take a virtual tour of our facility.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at Wildwood Orthopedic and Spine Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided at a ProMedica site free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

title: Stroke Clinic 2109 Hughes Drive, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Stroke Clinic
content.description:
Stroke Care

The central hub for ProMedica’s Stroke Network is the stroke clinic at ProMedica Toledo Hospital, the area’s first Comprehensive Stroke Center. Its highly specialized providers are committed to giving you the best possible care. 

Right here at our clinic, you have access to a wide spectrum of stroke care services.

  • Follow-up stroke care: To help manage the after effects of stroke, including issues with balance, memory, mood, spasticity, speech, weakness and balance.
  • Diagnosis of cerebrovascular diseases, including: Aneurysms, arteriovenous malformations (AVM), carotid artery stenosis, cavernous malformations, Dural AV Fistulas (DAVF), hemorrhagic strokes, hypertensive bleeds, ischemic strokes, subarachnoid hemorrhages and transient ischemic attacks (TIA).
  • Risk factor assessment: We’ll Identify and help you control cerebrovascular disease and stroke risk factors, as well as provide prevention and awareness counseling.
  • Second opinion consultations.
  • Treatment for cerebrovascular diseases, including: Angioplasty, carotid endarterectomy, clot evacuation, hemichraniectomy, intra-arterial tPA, mechanical thrombectomy, stenting, tPA and ventriculostomy.

title: Tatiana Masyk, MD - Adrian - Family Medicine - 901 Kimole Lane, Adrian, Michigan (MI), 49221
The Cullen Center | ProMedica

content.name: The Cullen Center
content.description:
The Cullen Center offers outpatient pediatric behavioral health assessments, counseling and group support (no psychiatric services). We are a member of the National Child Traumatic Stress Network (NCTSN).

We have a community that has the knowledge, resources, and commitment to support children, teens and their families who have experienced traumatic events. Our vision is to help them to heal and reclaim their lives. Several examples of trauma are:

  • Physical, sexual, or psychological abuse or neglect
  • Witnessing violence in the home, school or community
  • Sudden or violent loss of a family member or friend
  • Victim of crime
  • Serious accidents or life-threatening illness
  • Accident, fire, injury or other disaster
  • Natural or technological disasters or terrorism
  • Bullying/cyberbullying
  • Military family-related stressors (e.g., deployment, parental loss or injury)

Without treatment, repeated childhood exposure to traumatic events can affect the brain and nervous system and increase health-risk behaviors (e.g., smoking, eating disorders, substance use, and high-risk activities). Research shows that child trauma survivors can be more likely to have long-term health problems (e.g., diabetes and heart disease) or to die at an earlier age. Traumatic stress can also lead to increased use of health and mental health services and increased involvement with the child welfare and juvenile justice systems. Adult survivors of traumatic events may also have difficulty in establishing fulfilling relationships and maintaining employment.

The mission of The Cullen Center is to recognize the family as an expert and develop mutually respectful and equal partnerships among trauma survivors, families and professionals. Part of our job as experts is to find the best possible tools available to help families reclaim their lives. We accomplish through evidence-based and best practice trauma-focused counseling and education. A therapy model is considered evidence-based when it has been tested and proven to improve children’s performance and reduce children’s trauma-related symptoms.

Following are therapies we currently provide are:

  • Trauma-focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT)
  • Child Parent Psychotherapy (CPP)
  • Attachment, Regulation Competency therapy (ARC)
  • Theraplay and Theraplay techniques
  • STRONG Families therapy
  • Cognitive Processing Therapy (CPT)
  • Trauma-informed Parenting (TIP)
  • Hip Hop HEALS (H3 )
  • Individual and family counseling

In addition, trauma-informed individual and family interventions such as:

  • Support
  • Child and family education
  • Crisis intervention

Other services we provide for the community include:

  • Trauma-informed consultation
  • Community education

ACCESSING OUR SERVICES

Our goal is to determine if our services will best meet your child’s needs. Please contact our office at 419-291-7919 so we can conduct a brief phone screening to determine appropriateness.

If services is deemed suitable, then we will then make an appointment for you to attend a new client orientation to complete initial paperwork and to learn about The Cullen Center and trauma-focused therapy. Following the orientation, we will schedule your child for a diagnostic assessment. While we may have suggestions for which therapist we think may be a good fit for your child, we do appreciate your input.

Begin to heal. Your child, with the support of our experts, treatment, information and you, can reclaim childhood and continue growing toward a healthy life.
